rules.description: Word navigation & selection (Windows Ctrl behavior)
Browsers: Ctrl+Shift+N -> New Incognito / Private Window
Browsers (Chromium): Windows parity â€” Downloads/History/Clear data/Zoom (robust zoom-out)
Browsers: Full Windows browser shortcut parity (Ctrl/Alt muscle memory)
Microsoft Teams: Option+A -> Cmd+Shift+M (Mute / Unmute)
Browsers: Ctrl+Shift+T -> Cmd+Shift+T (Reopen closed tab)
Browsers: Ctrl+R -> Cmd+R (Refresh)
Laptop Home/End: Fn+Left=Home, Fn+Right=End
Laptop Fn helpers: Fn+Backspace=deleteForward, Fn+I=Insert
Alt+Tab -> Cmd+Tab (macOS app switcher)
Windows snapping: Win+Arrow (RIGHT_CMD+Arrow) -> macOS tiling (Fn+Ctrl+Arrow)
Alt+F4 close window; Alt+Shift+F4 quit app
Windows clipboard: Ctrl+Insert=Copy, Shift+Insert=Paste, Shift+Delete=Cut (both Delete types)
Browsers: Ctrl+Shift+C -> Inspect Element (Cmd+Option+C)
Browsers: Alt+D -> Address bar (Cmd+L) + Ctrl+L -> Cmd+L
Windows word delete: Ctrl+Backspace / Ctrl+Delete -> Option+Backspace/Delete (EXCEPT VS Code + terminals)
Home/End: Shift selects line; Ctrl+Shift selects document (incl. fn+arrows)
Windows Ctrl shortcuts -> macOS Cmd shortcuts (EXCEPT VS Code + terminals)
Finder (File Explorer muscle memory): F2 rename, Del, Shift+Del, Alt+Enter, Alt+Left/Right, Alt+Up (supports both Delete types)
VS Code only: Win+Space -> Cmd+P (Quick Open)
Windows key shortcuts (Win = RIGHT_CMD): Explorer/Settings/Lock/Desktop/Screenshot/Task View/Desktops/Emoji/Activity Monitor + Run
